channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: Joe Biden plays down chances of UK-US trade deal
item.description: The US president's comments come as he met Boris Johnson for talks in the White House.

item.title: Taliban ask to speak at UN General Assembly in New York
item.description: The group wants to address world leaders, weeks after ousting Afghanistan's former government.

item.title: Melbourne earthquake: Tremor rattles southeast Australia
item.description: A 5.8 magnitude earthquake rattles Australia's second largest city, causing damage to buildings.

item.title: Willie Garson: Sex and the City star dies aged 57
item.description: The actor was known for his role as Stanford Blatch on the long-running series and films.

item.title: Gabby Petito: Body found in Wyoming is missing 'van life' blogger
item.description: A coroner says the 22-year-old's death was a homicide but gives no details as to how she died.

item.title: Covid-19: India health workers' families fight for compensation
item.description: The government hailed health workers as heroes, but families of many who died still await compensation.

item.title: Life at 50C: Heat hitting home in Australia
item.description: Cities like Sydney are already experiencing extremely hot days because of climate change.

item.title: China pledges to stop building new coal energy plants abroad
item.description: The announcement is the country's latest climate pledge and a major step forward to address emissions.

item.title: Canary Islands volcano: Hundreds more evacuated as La Palma lava nears sea
item.description: Officials fear lava could trigger toxic gasses when it reaches the sea on the Canary Islands resort.

item.title: Evergrande: Crisis-hit firm strikes China debt deal
item.description: The company is also due to make a $83.5m interest payment on an offshore bond on Thursday.

item.title: Record backlog of cargo ships at California ports
item.description: Some 65 container ships are stuck outside the ports of Los Angeles and Long Beach, amid trade bottlenecks.

item.title: K-pop stars BTS perform at UN General Assembly
item.description: The UN general debate opened with K-pop band BTS, followed by a speech about sustainable development.

item.title: Are 241 million vaccine doses at risk of going to waste?
item.description: Joe Biden wants more global vaccine equality but the US and other nations have not backed promises with action.

item.title: Aukus: Australia's big gamble on the US over China
item.description: Australia has taken a central role in the Aukus defence pact - there are major benefits and risks too.

item.title: World War Two: The brothers who fled Nazi occupation by kayak
item.description: The "Engelandvaarders" who paddled from the Netherlands to England 80 years ago.

item.title: COP 26: How much is the developing world getting to fight climate change?
item.description: Are rich countries living up to their climate promises to the developing world?

item.title: German elections: Businesses face future without Merkel
item.description: Many companies in Germany are focused on short-term survival in the hope of medium-term revival.

item.title: Fifa 22 soundtrack: Why getting on it is a 'bucket list' moment
item.description: This is what it means to young artists to be featured on the playlist for the latest Fifa game.

item.title: Imran Khan: Afghan women 'are very strong'
item.description: Pakistan's prime minster suggests that, in time, women can "assert their rights" under the Taliban.

item.title: A year in Calais: One migrant’s year-long attempt to cross the Channel
item.description: The BBC followed Iranian migrant Alex, as he tried to cross from France to the UK with a smuggler.

item.title: La Palma volcano: Lava destroys homes in the Canary Islands
item.description: A volcanic eruption on the Spanish island of La Palma has demolished homes and caused evacuations.

item.title: Fauci looks to boost vaccines as US infections rise
item.description: The US daily death toll from Covid-19 has risen above 2,000 for the first time since February.
